intro: Solenostemon gouanensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often with contrasting white or yellow markings. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact size and long-lasting blooms.
